chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephon M Hiler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child AMENDED FROM 1ST DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT OF A CHILD, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.
Probation may be transferred to Arizona.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain employment.  May not work or volunteer where minors are present.

Provide a DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Comply with Sex Offender Registry and complete sex offender assessment and treatment.  Comply with mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations.  Participate in cognitive thinking therapy and other counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  No contact with victim or her family.   Firearm prohibition warning givent.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
